title: antsSliceRegularizedRegistration
description: This program is a user-level application for slice-by-slice translation registration. Results are regularized in z using polynomial regression. The program is targeted at spinal cord MRI. Only one stage is supported where a stage consists of a transform; an image metric; and iterations, shrink factors, and smoothing sigmas for each level. Specialized for 3D data: fixed image is 3D, moving image is 3D. Registration is performed slice-by-slice then regularized in z. The parameter -p controls the polynomial degree. -p 0 means no regularization.

polydegree.title: Polynomial degree
polydegree.description: Degree of polynomial up to zDimension-2. Controls the polynomial degree. 0 means no regularization.

output.title: Output transform prefix
output.description: Specify the output transform prefix (output format is .nii.gz). Optionally, one can choose to warp the moving image to the fixed space, and if the inverse transform exists, one can also output the warped fixed image.

metric.title: Metric
metric.description: Four image metrics are available: GC: global correlation, CC: ANTS neighborhood cross correlation, MI: Mutual information, and MeanSquares: mean-squares intensity difference.

transform.title: Transform
transform.description: Several transform options are available. The gradientStep or learningRate characterizes the gradient descent optimization.

iterations.title: Iterations
iterations.description: Specify the number of iterations at each level.

shrink_factors.title: Shrink factors
shrink_factors.description: Specify the shrink factor for the virtual domain (typically the fixed image) at each level.

smoothing_sigmas.title: Smoothing sigmas
smoothing_sigmas.description: Specify the amount of smoothing at each level.

mask.title: Mask in fixed image space
mask.description: Fixed image mask to limit voxels considered by the metric.

interpolation.title: Interpolation
interpolation.description: Several interpolation options are available in ITK.
